Plastic waste could be reduced significantly, as biodegradable plastic would break down naturally in a shorter amount of time, reducing the need for waste management and recycling systems.
The environment would be protected, as plastic waste would not accumulate in landfills or oceans, reducing the risk of pollution and harm to wildlife.
The use of biodegradable plastic would increase, as consumers would be more likely to choose eco-friendly options.
The plastic industry would need to adapt and develop new materials and production methods to keep up with the demand for biodegradable plastic.

The biodegradation of plastic would have a significant impact on the economy, as it would require new industries and job opportunities to develop and maintain the production and distribution of biodegradable plastic.
